comments:
The following error was reported while "processing debug async queue". We 
should likely handle/suppress VM disconnected exceptions in this case.

com.sun.jdi.VMDisconnectedException: Got IOException from Virtual Machine
at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.connect.PacketReceiveManager.getReply
(PacketReceiveManager.java:167)
at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.connect.PacketReceiveManager.getReply
(PacketReceiveManager.java:184)
at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.MirrorImpl.requestVM(MirrorImpl.java:174)
at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.MirrorImpl.requestVM(MirrorImpl.java:192)
at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.MirrorImpl.requestVM(MirrorImpl.java:207)
at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.ObjectReferenceImpl.monitorInfo
(ObjectReferenceImpl.java:136)
at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.ObjectReferenceImpl.waitingThreads
(ObjectReferenceImpl.java:181)
at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.model.JDIObjectValue.getWaitingThreads
(JDIObjectValue.java:288)
at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.monitors.JavaMonitor.update
(JavaMonitor.java:132)
at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.monitors.JavaMonitor.refresh
(JavaMonitor.java:218)
at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.monitors.JavaMonitorThread.refresh
(JavaMonitorThread.java:286)
at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.monitors.ThreadMonitorManager$RefreshAndDetec
tDeadlock.run(ThreadMonitorManager.java:218)
at org.eclipse.debug.core.DebugPlugin$AsynchJob.run(DebugPlugin.java:1026)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:67)

Fixed in JDIObjectValue#getOwningThreads() and #getWaitingThreads(). We should 
handle JDI runtime exceptions, but ignore VM diconnected.
